S.FORM: ya na ikapito no toki am ko mangay do gako.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: ya mapakzikzing am, ya somdep do pivatvatekan o sinsi namen, maniring o nipamnekan namen a panirsiringen am “tomanek! amlogod.”
S.TRANSL: 上課鐘響，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: “kamina kong” koan namen a ya mazizigton.
S.TRANSL: 我們很有精神的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: macinanao namen am, nanaoen na yamen no sinsi do ipivilavilang no Tao.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Yami language of numbers.

S.FORM: namen to macilolo do sinsi a mivilang, namen nianood paa o anood no vilavilang.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: ya aro o ko katengengan rana ciriciring no Tao.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Yami languages.

S.FORM: ko mangday so araraw a mangay do gako, ko mangday so araraw a macinanao do ciriciring no Tao, ta ipamizing ko jira ama a ka ni ina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給爸爸媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Yami language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ngaran ko am si Mamzat.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Mamzat。
My name is Mamzat.

S.FORM: ngaran ni ama am siaman Manineng.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是siaman Manineng。
My dad’s name is Manineng.

S.FORM: ngaran ni ina am sinan Manineng.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是sinan Manineng。
My mother’s name is Manineng.

S.FORM: ya asa ngarnan o kakawakawan ko siciawan ya.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: ya asa o kaka ko a mehakay, ngaran na am si Manineng, ya asa so ikaroa na ngarnan no kakawakawan na.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Manineng，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Manineng, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: ya namen miyangay so pivatvatekan a gako.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: yaken a ka ni kaka mehakay am, namen teymakey a mianoanood.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: ko makey a miawawat, no ya miwalam am, namen mangay miawawat a asa ka vahay.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: ko makey a maciboang do vayo a kagagan, ta apia a kapieza namen a mangay mianoanood a ka no miawawat.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: yaken am anak no tao do pongso.
S.TRANSL: 我是達悟族的小孩。
I am an tao child.

S.FORM: namen mivaay do Takaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在高雄。
Our family lives in Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: namen lalima a ka tao do vaay namen.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: namen talo a maketeketeh do vaay namen.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: yaken a ka ni ama a ka ni ina a ka nira kaka a ya matovong do vaay namen.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ya makarang si ama, si ama am mikalsong.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Ya magolang si ina, si ina am koysang.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: No ya mian si ama do vaay namen am, na sirisiringen yamen no ciring no tao do pongso.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Tao language with us at home.

S.FORM: namen makarakarala do pongso no ya maid o araraw no namen ipiweywalam.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Yaken a ka nira kaka am namen mateneng a manozatoza.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Ko isaray yamen a asa ka vaay.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: no ka madagdag ya am namen niamlivon si ina.
S.TRANSL: 今天上午我和媽媽去環島。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: ya mowgaraw o angit no ya maraw, o kakawan am ya ji arekmeh a ya ji annget, a ya masazowsaw.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: namen mian do Jipanatosan am, namen kanen o mavaw namen, o zezak am ya tomiray do kataotao namen a ya ikehteng.
S.TRANSL: 我們在雙獅岩吃著點心，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: ya makoyab am, ya mipabazangbang rana o angit.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: ko pacicin si ina am, “ya na ikabazangbang no angit ang?”
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽:「為甚麼天空是紅色的。」
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: maniring si ina am “ala ya amian so pagpag a ya mai.”
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說:「可能是颱風要來了。」
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: ya mahep rana am abo rana o cinalab do angit, ya mitotoaw rana o mata no angit.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: ya namen mangay rana do vahay namen.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: namen mian pa do rarahan am, ko patanangen o nakenakem ko do mata no angit.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: inaoy no ji ngai o kakawan, ta ko akzeben pa a kalivon.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再環島。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: ya mian do katangked no vahay namen o gako ko, ko mangday so araraw a ya malam a mangey do gako, no ya misiasiay am ko malam a moli do vahay namen.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ya alikey o gako namen, ya abo do na ka aro no ya mivatvatek a kakanakan, so namen ipakasingkad do kadoan jiamen.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: namen maloalovot do rako a inaorod no gako namen a ya mibozo a ya mawalawalam.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: sia mai a macialalam jiamen o sinsi, namen akmey a asa ka vahay a ya mian do gako.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: namen mangday so araraw do gako a ya mivias, ta namen pingsanan o saad no namen pacinanaoan a vahay.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: tatasa ka tao am ya omlinas do pazezevengan, karoan jiamen am ya mivias.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: mangay do sirisiri no gako namen a ya namen avyasan, namen tominanakman o maciavazavazay namen a ya pivazain, so na kawadwad no gako namen a mangday so araraw.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: nokakyab am, nimangay ko a ataoen si akay do Jimowrod.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去紅頭部落探望爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: ko mownay rana ji nimacita si akay, ko ikapaw iya.
S.TRANSL: 我很久沒有見到爺爺了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: na ka pakacita jiaken ni akay am, na pakanen yaken so somon, na ka pinom jiaken so asoy no anioy.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝椰子汁。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink coconut juice.

S.FORM: ya maganinam o na nimoa ni akay a somon, ya teyapia kanen.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: ko ikakey o asoy no anioy, ta ya manao a inomen.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡椰子汁，也很好喝。
I also like coconut juice, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: ya miigen o araw am, ko sidongen si akes a ya manotong.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我幫奶奶一起煮飯。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: ya aro o na nipansahadan ni akes a iyakan namen, ya mian so among a ka no manok a ka no piniow a ka no peyret.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的佳餚，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有田螺。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and river snails.

S.FORM: namen teyka koman am, namen mangay mangotod so voong no balangbang.
S.TRANSL: 吃完餐後，我們去摘過溝菜野菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: ya aro o wakay a ka no soli a ka no vizaoz a da nivaon jiaken nira akay.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺和奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和香瓜送給我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and melon, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: ko taitaiden rana sira akay am, ko maniring am “sira akay kong, akes kong, cia’a ta sipisa am mai ko a omatao jinio an.”
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別時，我說：「阿公阿嬤，沒關係，我下次會再來看您們。」
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: nokapepnezak am, na yangay yamen no sinsi do panitanitan so omalalam, namen mian do asdesdepan am ya namen minazabi a manazang so kipo.
S.TRANSL: 今天早上，老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: namen somdep rana do panitanitan so omalalam am, maniring o sinsi am “ya mian do kananman tamo eya am miasasalap, do teyrala rana ori am volavolay, to tanio ngonongi o kapilingalingay takamo.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: ko mamogaw no volay ang, so ji ko nimangai do dang a manita.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: aro o nimacita ko a miasasalap, somalasalap sira do toos, macita ko pa a o totoo a mitkeh do tonga no kayo.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: karoan no omalalam am mian so panganpen a ka no baka a ka no kokoman so tao, ji ko pa nimakacita so akman so sang a omalalam, ko macita rana siciaraw ya am ko na masaray.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有白鼻心、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: ya aro o ko nisiva a siasing, ta ko ipacita jira ama a ka ni ina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: sipisa am macizeza ko jira ama a ka ni ina a mai do jia.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: no kapiwalam ya am, nimangay namen si kaka a mavakes do Taitong a omatao si maran.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: nimapo namen do pongso a omavang do sikoki a mangay do Taitong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從蘭嶼搭飛機去臺東。
We took the train from Lanyu to Taitung.

S.FORM: makaranes namen do Taitong am, mialeleh si maran a tomazapia jiamen do sinanap.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來機場接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: o vahay ni maran am abo do karai na do sinanap, so nikakeykai na makaranes.
S.TRANSL: 飛機場離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: do katangked no vahay ni maran am mian so rako a pamangamanganan so baka, ori nikalololo namen a mialeleh a mangay do dang.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: mian namen do pamangamanganan so baka am, pehzaen na yamen ni maran a mapamangan so kagling a ka avang namen do likod no baka.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎在馬背上。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: maep rana am, mehzehza namen a mangay do akakanan a koman.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: aro o aleleh do avak no ili Jitaitong, so nipiotobay namen a mangay do dang.
S.TRANSL: 台東市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: meylis namen rana do dang am, aspangan namen o otobay a nitakaw da rana, so to namen rana ngavangi do avavangan no tao a aleleh.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: siciaikoa ya am namen rana nimakarala, manngo paro o otobay ni maran a ya na rana nimakala an?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到蘭嶼了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有？
Now that we are back in Lanyu, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: no kalialikey ko pa am mivahay namen do Jivalino, mivatvaket ko rana am mangay namen do ilaod, ori to namen ngiyani do rako a mahataw.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在野銀部落，上學以後，就搬到了台灣本島，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Jivalino. After I started school, we moved to Taiwan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: mivatvatek ko rana do kakarangan a gako am, vilangan ko o monganay do kasasaodan no vazavazay no Yancoming a vakong, ori nipakatenngan ko rana do meyciamadadayan a iweywawalam no Yancoming do Taiwan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: ori, no ka teyteyka ya do nipiwalam namen am, yaken a ka ni kaka mehakay am nimakarala namen a omatao so apapnan namen a rararakeh, naknakmen namen kapakamizing so iweywawalam namen a Tao nokakoa.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到蘭嶼拜訪部落年老的親戚，想要聽聽自己族群從前的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: ya sikawao so kakawakawan rana o rarakeh, am no ya citaen am akman so malavayo pa a tao.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: apiaen na yaken ni akay a mapacici sia am, ipanci na o mabnek na ciriciring no peyciamahatawan. teymasonong o ipanci na ciriciring no tao, mangay do ciriciring no Ipong a ka no Amis a ka no ciriciring no dehdeh o katenngan na a ipanci.
S.TRANSL: 徵得阿公同意訪問，他回答會說的語言別。他的達悟語說得很流利，連日本話和簡單的阿美語及漢語也會說。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Tao and he can even speak Japanese, simple Pangcah and Chinese.

S.FORM: nipacici ko o rarakeh ori ipakateneng ko jia no kalialikey na pa am ninanao da no ciriciring no Ipong. no kalavayo na am nimasaneb a mangay do Taitong a manlangi do mogis no Amis, ori nipaciboang na. o ciriciring rana no dehdeh am, na nimahap do aro a kagagan na dehdeh, ori na ikaro no na katenengan a ipanci a ciriciring ang.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候上過日本教育；他年輕時，常去台東幫阿美族割稻打工，順便學阿美語；現在會說漢語是因為他有很多漢族朋友，所以他會說這麼多語言。

I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child.When he was young, he often went to Taitung to help the Amis harvest rice and work, and learned the Amis language; and he has many Han friends, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: no kapacici namen jira am, aro o malavat da monganay do makeyneynaapan a tao nokakoa a nitaid da a adan a teneteneng da.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於漁獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: tana namen ji a mimin a masilo no ciciloan a amizingen o da ipanci am, ciaha ta namen nipatoong do patowtowngan so ciriciring rana, apia no amizingen am to iwanga.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂他們說的話，還好我們有用錄音機錄音，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: no kalialikey ko pa am ji ko pa atenngi o meyciamadadayan a masaod no iweywawala namen, ori o ikasnek ko a ipanci da a Yancoming.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: ya to miparo o ya ko nimamizing am, ya ko rana katenngan o monganay do iweywawalam namen do pongso, ya mapeyzokab a ya ko pacikazwayan.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為達悟族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tao is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: simakoyab ya am, ya mai rana si wari a mehakay.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: namen mangay si akes do pananazangan so manok, ta dengdengen namen a yakan ni wari a mehakay.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: miavas namen do pananazangan so yasay am, aro do dang o vayo pa nikotod da yasay.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，那裡有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: kapanazang namen rana so insay a ka no ovi a ka no omaom.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和山蘇。
We bought water spinach, yams and Bird’s-nest fern.

S.FORM: maniring do katangked na o pananazang so asi no kayokayo am “ya maganinam o pinapo a ka no kolitan ya, manazang kamo an!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和芒果很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and mango are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: miratateng am manazang namen so pinapo a ka no kolitan.
S.TRANSL: 後來我們買了鳳梨和芒果。
We bought pineapples and mango.

S.FORM: miavas namen do pananazangan so viniay am, maniring o lawpan ”ikongo o ya mo sazangan? o manok siciaraw ya am, ya arako a ya matava paa, ngina no asa am ya atlo a ranaw.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: singaten ni akes kapacici na so lawpan, a apia kapaveveh so ngina na.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: am maniring o lawpan am “ya ji aveveh rana o ngina na, marahet kapakas paa so ngina na”.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: mian do katangked na asa ka lawpan am “manazang kamo so among ko an, ta ya ararako a ya maveveh paa so ngina.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: miratateng am manazang namen rana so manok a ka no among, mian do vahay namen am makapia namen a nimansahad do asa ka akakanan a iyakan.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: nimownay namen a to nanala si wari, todaji ahep rana.
S.TRANSL: 我們等了好久，天就快黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: mizingwa si wari jiamen am ”ya tongian so makdeng a vazay do itaysang jia, so namen ji miwalami rana, si pisa ka piwalam am ori ko ipiwalam.”
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說：「軍隊突然有重要的事不能放假了，下一個禮拜日是我的假日。」
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: maniring si akes am “aro a ya nidengdeng ito a, angay panci sira maran mo a maci’angang jiaten.”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫舅舅他們一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: ka panci namen paa nira zipos namen, mai a maci’angang jiamen.
S.TRANSL: 我們還邀請了其他親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: amian kehakay ko a mingaran si Kacivaw, iya rana am mawawaden.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kacivaw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kacivaw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: no mivatvatek namen am, mamood do kararay namen so ipivatvatek a ka no ipangongopas nojia pivatvatkan a vakong.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: toda ipisa a ipidoa a ipitlo am, vooden namen pa jia.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: am mian so marahet a iyangay na, o nivood na am ji na paolia rana.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: am, amian so karahetan na, ta o nivood na am ji na rana paolia.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: ipisa do araraw, malovot namen a mangay miyowyow.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: mian pa do avak no rarahan am, kadasan si Kacivaw ori a am ji nimapalolo so ipilinalinas na mehma vakong.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，si Kacivaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kacivaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: mamood do kararay namen so ipilinalinas na am, patovisan da am “ko ji nimapalilio.”
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說：「我也沒有帶耶。」
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: to rana lavi si Kacivaw a mioyaoya manci no “nio rana ji voodji nia jiaken so ipilinalinas?”
S.TRANSL: si Kacivaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說：「為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙？」
Kacivaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tovisan da no kararay namen am “mo kangay ori a ya ji mapalolo, no ya vooden jimo am, mo na ji paolia!”
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他：「因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!」
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: ikadoa na araw am, nimadagdag si Kacivaw a makaranes do gako, ka paoli na rana so niveyvood na do kararay namen.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，si Kacivaw很早就到學校了，si Kacivaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kacivaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: koan ni Kacivaw am “ji kamo makasnek ang, ciaha ta manaken ko rana o kapalolo ko so aaapen ko. ayoy o niveyvood nio jiaken a meyciamadadayan, ayoy.”
S.TRANSL: si Kacivaw向同學們說：「我向大家道歉，以後我一定會記得帶東西，謝謝同學們之前願意借我東西，謝謝︕」
Kacivaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: ya makeyneynaaapan si maran do ili namen.
S.TRANSL: 我的叔叔是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: no kalialikey ko pa am, no makoyab am mayai do vahay namen si maran a somivah si ama, apen da o paltog a ka no zingki a miyowyaw.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，叔叔常會在晚上來家裡約爸爸，他們帶著魚槍和手電筒出門。
When I was young, my uncle used to come home at night to ask Dad out. They went out with a fish gun and a flashlight

S.FORM: no avak no ahep am, ioli da o niaaapa da do vahay namen.
S.TRANSL: 三更半夜時，他們就會帶著獵到的魚獵回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: nomakatakaw am vaoyo o nipaltogan da, nomakatakaw am pai nojia koyta o nisowan da, no to da sapa am anos.
S.TRANSL: 有時候他們射到的是鮪魚、有時候是捉到龍蝦和章魚，偶爾也會有魷魚。
Sometimes it was tuna, sometimes lobster and octopus, and occasionally squid.

S.FORM: no maraw am mida ipanci sira zipos namen a mai do vahay namen a maci’angang.
S.TRANSL: 白天他們會請親戚朋友來家裡，分享給族人一起吃。
During the day, they would invite relatives and friends to come to their homes and share the prey with their people.

S.FORM: no macita ko si maran a mai do vahay namen am, pasaozen ko si ama a mapehza jiaken a mangday mipaltog.
S.TRANSL: 我每次看到叔叔來家裡都會吵著爸爸，帶著我一起去射魚。
Every time I saw my uncle coming to my house, I would quarrel with my father and take me with me to go fishing.

S.FORM: no maniring si ama am “ji topanomanoma o ciring ta makaniow.” no makaveyvow ko rana am ori ipaciboang ko.
S.TRANSL: it’s taboo.\" I can learn when I grow up."
Dad said, \Don’t say anything first

S.FORM: sira memehakay do ili namen am, maloalovot sira mitawaz do awa ipiyakan so vayo a among no asa kaili.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會一起出海網魚，讓整個部落都有魚吃。
The men of the tribe also go out to sea to net fish, so that the whole tribe has fish to eat.

S.FORM: ya mateneng si ama a mamaring so paltog do awa, si maran a wari ni ama am, ya manineng a mipaltog do kalilian, ori da kasanib a meyeyheza mangahahap.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作漁槍，我的叔叔也就是爸爸的弟弟射魚很準，所以他們才會常結伴去捕魚。
My dad is very good at making Harpoon. My uncle, my father’s younger brother, is fishing very accurate, so they often go fishing together.

S.FORM: to ko akzeba ka pakaveyvow ko rana a maciangay jira mipaltog, ori ikasanib ko a omtahataha a tomezgek do kalilian, ji nimeyyahahay a kapakanet na rana no ineynawa ko a somwat so kono do kalilian.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去射魚，我常常練習游泳潛水，很快地我的肺活量已可在海裡礁岩挖硨磲貝了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I often practiced swimming and diving, and soon my lung capacity was ready to dig for shellfish in the rocks of the sea.

S.FORM: macita na ni ama am payaiten na yaken, no mavyay o tao am ipamaring ko imo so paltog mo an.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後鼓勵我，等我以後長大了一定會幫我做魚槍。
My father encouraged me when he saw it. Told me when I grow up, he would make me a shotgun.

S.FORM: ya ko rana makaveyvow am, ya mian rana so paltog ko a maciheza jira ama a ka ni maran a mangay mipaltog.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我有魚槍了，也有機會跟著爸爸和叔叔一起去射魚。
Now that I’m older, I’ve got a fish gun and a chance to go fishing with my father and uncle.

S.FORM: no mang-id namen rana a nimakamong am, magaga si ina a ka nira akay.
S.TRANSL: 我們獵魚上岸後回到家裡，媽媽和爺爺他們都很高興。
When we got home from fishing, Mom and Grandpa were very happy.

S.FORM: sira akay a ka ni akes am ipanlanlag da yaken, isaray do tao do to a niomzat jiamen do kalilian a manta ni yamen so sinaaapan.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺奶奶也會給我祝福，並且感謝天神保佑我們海裡射魚，賜給我們有很多的魚獵。
My grandparents will also bless me, and thank the gods for blessing us to shoot fish in the sea, give us a lot of prey.

S.FORM: no ka madagdag am. ji ko nimapis kangay ko meyvatvatek.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: mangay ko do gako am, nyawaw ko a ji nimapalolo so kabang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ji abo nyahap ko a nipalolo.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: no kapivatvatek namen, to namen raroa a citan o asa ka vakong.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: no kapisikin, voodan ko o pivatvatek aka no ipangongopas do kararay ko.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: koan na yaken no sinsi, “ma dagdag ka mivangon, ji ka mipahahay!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: kagagan ko si Anopan, kanakan iya do pongso.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Anopan，他也是雅美(達悟)族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Anopan, and he is also an Tao child.

S.FORM: nimiheza namen do jiratay a mivatvatek.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在漁人部落讀書。
We study together in the jiratay tribe.

S.FORM: namen masanib a amizeng so kavavatanen no rarakeh, namen matotopos manci so cireng no tao.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說雅美(達悟)語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tao proficiently.

S.FORM: ko makarang a matava paa, am si Anopan yamahehep a yamagozang.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Anopan很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Anopan is short and thin.

S.FORM: ya mazigton si Anopan, a da ikakza iya.
S.TRANSL: Anopan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Anopan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: ya mipeypalalayo do peyvatvatkan sicyaraw eya, aro o nipangay a pinenenetan ri.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: miyan dang so pinenenetan a kolili aka no mapatoktok so bozo aka no mipalalayo sira kano mapaltog pa.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: ko meypeypalalayo do dang.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: no ka palalayo ko, ni malektek ko a ka tona piraralan no atod ko.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: am mivagon ko rana a tomanek a mangay do palayyoan ko.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: miyan ko rana makaranes do palayyoan ko, masasaray sira tao.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: tana ji nimangay do manma na do palayyoan ko, am ko masaray, ta nimavos rana do peynenenetan ko.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: yakan kani ama nimangay namen itazogaw si maran nokakyab.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: nimizahza o ai na ni maran.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: koan na yamen, nimakava o atep no vahay na kangyan no tong.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: no kapivazay na do atep no vahay am, nimakas do atep a mizahza..
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: nimapalolo si ama so asisi no baka aka no mamahen a itoro na ji maran
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: ko macisirisiring ji maran do irirayan, aro na ni ononongan a vazavazay.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: ko na itaytaydan si maran am, na azwazwain yaken ka namakarang a apiya so ka mawmawgan""
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: koan ko am: si apiya rana o ai mo maran am. mai ka do vahay namen.
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: 2022 no kawan, pikaygi da abnekan no seyvo o ngaran do mibonsyow no yancomin.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: pacicihen ko masanib a mazyak no vazay a abneken o mibonsyo no yancomin si Tahaw tao do pangso.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年si Tahaw。
I interviewed si Tahaw, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: yaken kani ya misirisiring namen a si niciyo ranam mangay ko do vahay da a pacicien.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: pacicinen ko na do vahay da ka panci na jiaken so nikapwan no ngaran na, a ka pitotwaw da saka vahay ipakasingkad ko jira saka vahay kano sira sakayli.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: pacicien ko ikongo o mo kazyakan nya do paliten o ngaran no yancomin. marahet o adan a ipadket so ngaran?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: koan na yaken ni Tahaw, ta manoyong o pipipangayan no ngaran do cyokok, aro sira manci nyaken A-na, ikaro a malas a mapaming dang.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \A-na

S.FORM: koan na ni Tahaw am, “vatvatkan no yancomin a manoyong a ngaran namen do tao. ikasawop namen malayma tao do pongso, mapo ya do nyapowan namen, ngaran namen do pongso a makdeng ya, inaoy no aroa tao mababnek so ngaran do tao a yancomin.”
S.TRANSL: our family
si Tahaw said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: no kakyab am yakena kani akes a nimangay do pananazangan a mananazang so iyakan, aro nipalolo na ni akes o insay a nimowmowa na. kapamareng na sya so maganinam a iyakan no yancomin.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: da teykaza no tao o pananazangan ni akes, aro o nisazangan da o voong no wakay aka no omaom, tahaman no aro a tao o nirotongan ni akes ri.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，地瓜葉和山蘇很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the Sweet potato leaves and bird’s nest fern, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: o nipasisit na o omaom aka no nyamay na nimay ni akes am teymaganinam ri. aka no nitazaban na taroy ya, teyapiya kakanan na ori ikaroo no manazang sya, ya miyatoatonton sira do pananazangan ni akes.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的山蘇和芋頭糕非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

The bird’s nest fern and Taro cake she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: no yamapasisit si akes am, ko manalanala so manazang a tao. ko macyak a ipaci no, “nimownowa namen ya, teyapya ya a aboo kosozi jia, key! mai kamo manazang ang.”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: ya nimakaykai na kabo rana no iyakan a nipanazang, koan na ni akes: mina imo ri a nisomidong jiaken.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: makoan rana so pananazangan a vazay, aro nipacinanaoan ko so voovoong kano iyakan no yancomin a ko katenngan sira, aka no katopsan ko o kagiso no mananazang
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: macita ko si akes a makza no iyakan ta do pongso, isaray ko a ikazway do onowned ko.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
